txt.en: You have found some fresh fish on a rack outside of a locked-up home in the northern Whitshaws. You should find the owner of this home, likely a fisherman.\n\nA fisherman would likely be at the lake's edge, hopefully not far from his home.

The fisherman no longer looks as if he will attack you (which is a good sign).

'You mean us no harm, then? I am sorry we came at you like that. The wilds have been dangerous of late.

'What is an outsider like you doing wandering the Whitshaws while our enemies roam unhindered?'
You have found some fresh fish on a rack outside of a locked-up home in the northern Whitshaws. You should find the owner of this home, likely a fisherman.
'Enemy! We'll not suffer ye in the Whitshaws.\n\n'Run, or I'll have yer head.'
Search for the source of the smoke
The two fishermen are at their camp on the edge of the Isingmere, in the northern Whitshaws.\n\nYou should speak with the fishermen to encourage them to flee.
The two fishermen are at their camp on the edge of the Isingmere, in the northern Whitshaws.\n\nYou should speak with the fishermen, now that they are done attacking you on sight.
The fisherman can likely be found at the lake's edge.\n\nYou should search for the fisherman and encourage him to seek refuge in Forlaw.
The two fishermen are at their camp on the edge of the Isingmere, in the northern Whitshaws.\n\nYou should speak with the fishermen to encourage them to flee.

You noticed smoke from a campfire along the northern shore of the Isingmere in the Whitshaws. Either an enemy has settled here, or people of Wildermore are unwisely drawing attention to themselves.\n\nEither way, you should investigate the scene.
The two fishermen are at their camp on the edge of the Isingmere, in the northern Whitshaws.\n\nYou should speak with the fishermen, now that they are done attacking you on sight.
You spot a fishing camp manned by two rough-looking men. You should speak with the fishermen.
